name: src/es6/load-model.es6
constructor
description: Base loader class.

name: src/es6/load-pool.es6
constructor
description:
Base loader class. We don't use promise.all since we want to keep a 
limited pool of loaders, which accept a larger number of waitObjs. As 
each loadObj completes a load, it checks the queue to see if there is 
another loadObj neededing a load.

name: createWaitObj
description:
Add to the queue of unresolved wait objects, an object holding
directions for loading the asset and callback(s).

name: update
description: Update the queue.

name: load
description:
load objects into the waiting queue. This can happen very quickly. 
images are queue for loading, with callback for each load, and 
final callback. We use custom code here instead of a Promise for 
brevity and flexibility.

params.name: source
params.description: the path to the image file

params.name: callback
params.description: each time an image is loaded.

params.name: finalCallback
params.description: (optional) the callback executed when all objects are loaded.

constructor

name: src/es6/map2d.es6
getPixel
description:
Get a Map pixel. For the diamond algorithm, this.max is a width or 
height. For all others, it is the length of the entire array.

unknown.tagValue: {Number} the Map value at the x, z position.

params.name: x
params.description: the x coordinate of the pixel (column)

params.name: z
params.description: the z coordinate of the pixel (row)

params.name: edgeFlag
params.description:
how to handle requests off the edge of the map 
- WRAP: grab from other side, divide to zero).
- TOZERO: reduce to zero, depending on unit distance from edge.

return.description: the Map value at the x, z position.

name: setPixel
description: Set a pixel in the Map.

params.name: x
params.description: the x (column) coordinate in the Map.

params.name: z
params.description: the z (row) coordinate in the Map.

params.name: val
params.description: the value at a map coordinate, typically Float32

name: initPlane
description: Create a completely flat Map.

name: initRandom
description:
Generate a Map using completely random numbers clamped. 
to a range.

name: initDiamond
description:
Create a blank heightmap in canvas ImageData format. If 
random === true, make a random heightmap.
https://github.com/hunterloftis/playfuljs-demos/blob/gh-pages/terrain/index.html

params.name: create
params.description: if true, make a proceedural heightmap using diamond algorithm.

params.name: roughness
params.description: if create === true, assign a roughness (0 - 1) to generated terrain.

name: initImage
description: Use an RGBA image to create the heightmap, after drawing into <canvas>.

unknown.tagValue: https://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/webgl/typed_arrays/
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39678642/trying-to-convert-imagedata-to-an-heightmap

name: divide
description: Divide Map in Diamond algorithm.

name: average
description: Get average in Diamond algorithm.

name: square
description: new square, average value. Alternates with diamond.

name: diamond
description: new diamond, average value. Alternates with square.

name: flatten
description:
Scale heightMap y values (0.1 = 1/10 the max), 
passing 0 will completely flatten the map.

name: roughen
description: roughen an existing Map.

name: scale
description:
given an existing Map, scale to new dimensions, smoothing 
with the biCubic or biLinear algorithm.

name: biLinear
description:
Given a point defined in 2d between 
x and z, return an interpolation using a bilinear algorithm.

name: biCubicPoint
description:
Given a point, and a collection of 16 neighboring points in 
2d, return a smoothed value for the point using the 
biCubic interpolation algorithm.
Adapted from:
https://github.com/hughsk/bicubic-sample/blob/master/index.js
https://github.com/hughsk/bicubic/blob/master/index.js

name: biCubic
description: value interpolation

Initialize a Map3d from data. The first parameter is always 3d coordinates,

name: src/es6/prim.es6

unknown.tagValue:
Create object primitives, and return vertex and index data 
suitable for creating a VBO and IBO.

NOTE: if you need more complex shapes, use a mesh file, or 
a library like http://evanw.github.io/csg.js/ to implement 
mesh operations.

Implicit objects (values are units, with 1.0 being normalized size).

prim.position      = (vec5) [ x, y, z, rounding, | startSlice, endSlice,  ]
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]
prim.acceleration  = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]
prim.rotation      = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]
prim.angular       = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]
prim.color         = [ red1, green1, blue1, alpha1, red2, blue2... ]
prim.texure1Arr    = [ texture1, texture2, texture3 ]
prim.audioArr      = [ AudioObj1, AudioObj2, AudioObj3...]

More prims
Ogre 3d procedural
https://bitbucket.org/transporter/ogre-procedural/src/ca6eb3363a53c2b53c055db5ce68c1d35daab0d5/library/include/?at=default
https://bitbucket.org/transporter/ogre-procedural/wiki/Home

https://github.com/jagenjo/litegl.js/tree/master/src

http://wiki.unity3d.com/index.php/ProceduralPrimitives

octahedron sphere generation
https://www.binpress.com/tutorial/creating-an-octahedron-sphere/162
https://experilous.com/1/blog/post/procedural-planet-generation
https://experilous.com/1/planet-generator/2014-09-28/planet-generator.js
another octahedron sphere 
https://www.binpress.com/tutorial/creating-an-octahedron-sphere/162
rounded cube
https://github.com/vorg/primitive-rounded-cube
rounded cube algorithim
http://catlikecoding.com/unity/tutorials/rounded-cube/

generalized catmull-clark subdivision algorithm
https://thiscouldbebetter.wordpress.com/2015/04/24/the-catmull-clark-subdivision-surface-algorithm-in-javascript/

cube inflation algorithm
http://mathproofs.blogspot.com.au/2005/07/mapping-cube-to-sphere.html
advanced toolset
https://www.geometrictools.com/Samples/Geometrics.html
Eigen
https://fossies.org/dox/eigen-3.2.10/icosphere_8cpp_source.html
Geometry prebuilt
http://paulbourke.net/geometry/roundcube/
Lots of Webgl tricks!
https://acko.net
http://acko.net/blog/on-webgl/

https://gamedevdaily.io/four-ways-to-create-a-mesh-for-a-sphere-d7956b825db4#.lkbq2omq5
https://www.geometrictools.com/Samples/Geometrics.html

https://github.com/glo-js/primitive-icosphere
https://github.com/hughsk/icosphere
http://mft-dev.dk/uv-mapping-sphere/
http://donhavey.com/blog/tutorials/tutorial-3-the-icosahedron-sphere/
http://blog.andreaskahler.com/2009/06/creating-icosphere-mesh-in-code.html

https://www.binpress.com/tutorial/creating-an-octahedron-sphere/162

name: checkType
description:
See if supplied Prim type is supported. Individual Prim factory 
methods do more detailed checking.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} if supported, return true, else false.

return.description: if supported, return true, else false.

name: setId
description: Unique object id

unknown.tagValue: https://jsfiddle.net/briguy37/2MVFd/

name: setVertexData
description:
Get the big array with all vertex data. Every time a 
Prim is made, we store a reference in the this.objs[] 
array. So, to make one, we just concatenate the 
vertices. Use to send multiple prims sharing the same shader to one 
Renderer.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} vertices

return.description: vertices

name: setIndexData
description:
get the big array with all index data. Use to 
send multiple prims sharing the same shader to one 
Renderer.

name: createBufferObj
description: Return an empty buffer object.

name: addBufferData
description:
Add data to create buffers, works if existing data is present. However, 
indices must be consistent!

name: createBuffers
description: Create WebGL buffers using geometry data

params.name: bufferObj
params.description:
custom object holding the following:
an array of vertices, in glMatrix.vec3 objects.
an array of indices for the vertices.
an array of texture coordinates, in glMatrix.vec2 format.
an array of normals, in glMatrix.vec3 format.
an array of tangents, in glMatrix.vec3 format.
an array of colors, in glMatrix.vec4 format.

name: computeColors
description: Create default colors for Prim color array.

name: primReadout
description:
Check the values of a Prim.
TODO: why is itemsize of indices = 1

name: getStdVecs
description:
Standard vectors (similar to Unity) when needed. Call only 
if using the array literal (e.g. [ 0, 0, 0,]) doesn't make sense.

unknown.tagValue: https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Vector3.html

name: vec5
description:
Larger configuration vectors for Prims. additional values control slicing 
or flattening of part of a prim.
For CONE, the fourth value is truncation of the cone point.
For other Prims, the fourth and fifth values control the start and 
end of a cap on open prims (CYLINDER, CONE) and flattening of the 
top and bottom of SPHERE prims.

name: subDivide
description:
Subdivide a mesh, WITHOUT smoothing.
Comprehensive description.

unknown.tagValue:
http://www.rorydriscoll.com/2008/08/01/catmull-clark-subdivision-the-basics/
USE:
USE: https://blog.nobel-joergensen.com/2010/12/25/procedural-generated-mesh-in-unity/
USE: http://wiki.unity3d.com/index.php/MeshSubdivision
USE: https://thiscouldbebetter.wordpress.com/2015/04/24/the-catmull-clark-subdivision-surface-algorithm-in-javascript/
USE: https://github.com/Erkaman/gl-catmull-clark/blob/master/index.js
Examples:
http://vorg.github.io/pex/docs/pex-geom/Geometry.html
http://answers.unity3d.com/questions/259127/does-anyone-have-any-code-to-subdivide-a-mesh-and.html
https://thiscouldbebetter.wordpress.com/2015/04/24/the-catmull-clark-subdivision-surface-algorithm-in-javascript/

name: pointInTriangle
description:
Compute whether point is in a triangle, wrapped 
clockwise (begin with a, end with c)

unknown.tagValue: http://blackpawn.com/texts/pointinpoly/
{Boolean} if point in triangle, return true, else false.

return.description: if point in triangle, return true, else false.

name: computeNormals
description:
Compute normals for a 3d object. NOTE: some routines compute their 
own normals.
Adapted from BabylonJS version.

unknown.tagValue: https://github.com/BabylonJS/Babylon.js/blob/3fe3372053ac58505dbf7a2a6f3f52e3b92670c8/src/Mesh/babylon.mesh.vertexData.js
http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/8191/any-reliable-polygon-normal-calculation-code
https://www.opengl.org/wiki/Calculating_a_Surface_Normal

name: computeTangents
description:
Compute tangents. NOTE: some routines compute their own tangents.
CodePen - http://codepen.io/ktmpower/pen/ZbGRpW
adapted from the C++ code from this link: http://www.terathon.com/code/tangent.html
TODO: CONVERT TO GLMATRIX
"The code below generates a four-component tangent T in which the handedness of the local coordinate system
is stored as 1 in the w-coordinate. The bitangent vector B is then given by B = (N  T)  Tw."

name: geometryPointCloud
description:
WebGL point cloud (particle system).
Rendered as GL_POINT.

unknown.tagValue: https://github.com/potree/potree/releases
https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/sdk/demos/google/particles/index.html
https://github.com/gouzhen1/WebGL-Particle-System/
https://github.com/gouzhen1/WebGL-Particle-System/blob/master/index.html#L3

http://nullprogram.com/blog/2014/06/29/
https://codepen.io/kenjiSpecial/pen/yyeaKm
rendered as an array of GL_POINT.

{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

params.name: the
params.description:
Prim needing geometry. 
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, radius || 0, pointSize (pixels) | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

rendered as GL_LINE.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, thickness | 0 ]

type POLYGON.
rendered as GL_POLYGON.

unknown.tagValue:

Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometrySphere
description:
Objects created with uv methods (i.e. they have polar points).
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
startSlice cuts off the cylinder, and wraps the texture across the top. 
endSlize truncates the bottom of the cylinder, and wraps the texture across the bottom.
for an open cylinder with no caps, set startSlice and endSlize to zero.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startSlice | 0, endSlice | 0 ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometryCap
description:
type CAP
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
Just a flattened half-sphere creating a circular 'lid'.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startRadius | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometryDome
description:
type DOME
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
Half-sphere, visible from outside.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startRadius | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometryTopDome
description:
type TOPDOME.
rendered as WebGL TRIANGLES.
Half-sphere (equivalent to type DOME).
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startRadius | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

type SKYDOME
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
Half-sphere, Indices are reversed, so texture displays inside by default.

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

description:
type BOTTOMDOME
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
bowl shaped, formed from lower half of sphere.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometryCylinder
description:
type CYLINDER
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
Cylinder, either open or closed, visible from outside.
startSlice cuts off the cylinder, and wraps the texture across the top. 
endSlize truncates the bottom of the cylinder, and wraps the texture across the bottom.
for an open cylinder with no caps, set startSlice and endSlize to zero.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startSlice | 0, endSlice | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometryCone
description:
type CONE.
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES (equivalent to TOPCONE).
Cone can have segments sliced off its beginning or end.
startSlice cuts off the cone, and wraps the texture across the top. 
endSlize truncates the bottom of the cone, and wraps the texture across the bottom.
for a cone with no caps, set startSlice and endSlize to zero.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startSlice | 0, endSlice | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometryTopCone
description:
type TOPCONE.
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.(equivalent to CONE).
startSlice cuts off the cone, and wraps the texture across the top. 
endSlize truncates the bottom of the cone, and wraps the texture across the bottom.
for a cone with no caps, set startSlice and endSlize to zero.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startSlice | 0, endSlice | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

name: geometryBottomCone
description:
type BOTTOMCONE
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
Cone structure, pointing downwards.
startSlice cuts off the cone, and wraps the texture across the top. 
endSlize truncates the bottom of the cone, and wraps the texture across the bottom.
for a cone with no caps, set startSlice and endSlize to zero.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, startSlice | 0, endSlice | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

description:
TYPE SPINDLE.
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
Spindle (two cones stuck together).
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

unknown.tagValue:
{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents.

name: geometryCapsule
description:
type CAPSULE
rendered as WebGL TRIANGLES.
a cylinder with two spheres on each end, similar to capped cylinder, 
equivalent to a closed cube.

unknown.tagValue:
https://github.com/vorg/primitive-capsule
position x axis is the radius, y axis is the height z not used
dimensions x is number of steps along the y axis, dimensions y is the number of radial 
divisions around the capsule.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents.

name: geometryCube
description:
Create a PLANE, CUBE, or spherical object from cube mesh.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
type CUBE.
rendered as WebGL TRIANGLES.
adjust curveRadius to round the edges of the Cube.
used by several other Prim routines (CUBESPHERE, PLANE, OUTERPLANE, 
INNERPLANE, CURVEDPLANE, CURVEDOUTERPLANE, CURVEDINNERPLANE)
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, Prim.side, curveRadius ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

return.description:
geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents. 
Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

rendered as WebGL TRIANGLES.
visible from the 'outside' as defined by the outward vector from Prim.side.

prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

Creating WebGL buffers is turned on or off conditionally in the method.

geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents.

{Prim.geometry} geometry data, including vertices, indices, normals, texture coords and tangents.

name: geometryCurvedOuterPlane
description:
type CURVEDPLANE, CUREVEDOUTERPLANE
rendered as WebGL TRIANGLES.
visible from the 'outside' as defined by the outward vector from Prim.side.
curve radius sets the amount of curve by assigning a radius for a circle.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, Prim.side, curveRadius | 0 ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

name: geometryTerrain
description:
type TERRAIN.
rendered as GL_TRIANGLES.
Generate terrain, using a heightMap, from a PLANE object. The 
heightMap values are interpolated for each vertex in the PLANE.
prim.dimensions    = (vec4) [ x, y, z, Prim.side ]
prim.divisions     = (vec3) [ x, y, z ]

Create an octahedron
Note: the icosphere algorith returns an octahedron if we don't "inflate" 
the object's vertices by normalizing.

name: geometryTorus
description: Torus object

unknown.tagValue: https://blogoben.wordpress.com/2011/10/26/webgl-basics-7-colored-torus/

http://apparat-engine.blogspot.com/2013/04/procedural-meshes-torus.html
Creates a 3D torus in the XY plane, returns the data in a new object composed of
  several Float32Array objects named 'vertices' and 'colors', according to
  the following parameters:
r:  big radius
sr: section radius
n:  number of faces
sn: number of faces on section
k:  factor between 0 and 1 defining the space between strips of the torus

name: createPrim
description: Create an standard 3d object.

params.name: name
params.description: assigned name of object (not necessarily unique).

params.name: rotation
params.description: rotation vector (spin) around center of object.

params.name: textureImage
params.description: the path to an image used to create a texture.

params.name: color
params.description: the default color(s) of the object.

name: scale
description: Scale vertices directly, without changing position.

name: move
description:
Move vertices directly in geometry, i.e. for something 
that always orbits a central point.
NOTE: normally, you will want to use a matrix transform to position objects.

name: boundingBox
description:
Get the bounding box of a shape by getting the largest and 
smallest vertices in coordinate space.
TODO: incomplete.

name: getCentroid
description: Get the center of a shape.

unknown.tagValue: {GlMatrix.vec3} a array with the centroid x, y, z.

return.description: a array with the centroid x, y, z.

name: setMaterial
description: Set a material for a prim.

https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/blob/gh-pages/src/index.md

name: src/es6/shader-water.es6
src/es6/shader.es6
setup
description:
set up our program object, using WebGL. We wrap the 'naked' WebGL 
program object, and add additional properties to the wrapper. 

Individual shaders use these variables to construct a program wrapper 
object containing the GLProgram, plus properties, plus update() and 
render() functions.

name: src/es6/util.es6
constructor
description: Utility functions.

name: setPerformance
description: Performance polyfill for timing.

name: getArr
description: Get a succession of values from a flat array

unknown.tagValue: {Array} requested elements in an Array.

params.name: size
params.description:
number of elements to get. This is 
also assumed to be the 'stride' through the array.

return.description: requested elements in an Array.

name: setArr
description:
Get an object from a 2d array. Supply a variable list of 
values. The number of values is assumed to be the 'walk' size 
for the array.

params.name: additional
params.description:
arguments. The array 'stride' is 
assumed equal to the number of additional parameters.

name: canFlatten
description: Check if an array is multi-dimensional, and needs flattening.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} if multi-dimensional, return true, else false.

return.description: if multi-dimensional, return true, else false.

name: flatten
description:
Given a multi-dimensional array, flatten to 
a single-dimensional one. NOTE: only works for 
Array(), not Float32Array!

name: unFlatten
description: Given a flat array, convert to multi-dimensional.

name: concatArr
description:
Concatenate typed and untyped arrays. if the first array is typed, 
the second array is converted to the same type. The first array 
receives the concatenation (no new Array is created).

unknown.tagValue: {Array|TypedArray} the concatenated Array.

return.description: the concatenated Array.

name: getSeed
description: Random seed.

name: getMousePosition
description:
Handle mouse events, in case we aren't in VR. This function
adds mouse coordinates to the <canvas> element we are using to draw.

params.name: config
params.description: a configuration object, set in app.js.

name: clearTextures
description: Clear textures from the videocard before starting.

name: init
description: initialize with a canvas context

unknown.tagValue: {WebGLContext} the WebGL context of the <canvas> object.

params.name: canvas
params.description:
a HTML5 <canvas>, id for canvas, or undefined, 
in which case a <canvas> object is 
created and added to document.body, an ID value for a tag, or a CanvasDOMobject.

params.name: lostContext
params.description: callback when WebGL context is lost.

params.name: restoredContext
params.description: callback when WebGL context is restored.

return.description: the WebGL context of the <canvas> object.

name: getCanvas
description: Get WebGL canvas only if we've created a gl context.

unknown.tagValue: {HTMLCanvasElement} canvas the rendering <canvas>.

return.description: canvas the rendering <canvas>.

name: resizeCanvas
description:
Resize the canvas if the window changes size. 
NOTE: affected by CSS styles.
TODO: check current CSS style.
(TWGL)

name: createContext
description:
get HTML5 canvas, and a WebGL context. We also scan for multiple 
contexts being created ( > 1 ) and delete if one is already present.

unknown.tagValue: {WebGLRenderingContext} gl a WebGLRenderingContext.

params.name: canvas
params.description:
the HTML5 <canvas> DOM element.
TODO: PROBLEM IF THERE ARE MULTIPLE CONTEXES ON THE PAGE???????

return.description: gl a WebGLRenderingContext.

name: getContext
description:
Return the current context. Note that we don't store a 
separate reference to the canvas.

unknown.tagValue: {WebGLRenderingContext} gl a WebGLRenderingContext.

return.description: gl a WebGLRenderingContext.

name: killContext
description:
Kill the current context (complete reset will be needed). Also use to debug 
when context is lost, and has to be rebuilt.

unknown.tagValue: http://codeflow.org/entries/2013/feb/22/how-to-write-portable-webgl/
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WEBGL_lose_context/loseContext

name: ready
description: check if we have a contex and are ready to render.

name: clear
description: Clear the screen prior to redraw.

name: addVertexBufferSupport
description: Add vertex buffer support to WebGL 1.0

params.name: gl
params.description: a WebGL rendering context (should be 1.x only)l

name: createShader
description: create a WeGL shader object.

unknown.tagValue: {WebGLShader} a compiled WebGL shader object.

params.name: source
params.description: the shader source, as plain text.

return.description: a compiled WebGL shader object.

name: fetchShader
description: Use the Fetch API to get a shader file

name: createShaderFromTag
description: create shader form script element

params.name: tag
params.description: the script element, or its id

name: createProgram
description:
Create WebGL program with shaders. Program not used until 
we apply gl.useProgram(program).

name: createVarList
description:
Read shader code, and organize the variables in the shader 
into an object. Abstracts some of the tedious work in setting 
up shader variables.

unknown.tagValue:
{Object} an object organizing attribute, uniform, and 
varying variable names and datatypes.

params.name: sourceArr
params.description: array of lines in the shader.

return.description:
an object organizing attribute, uniform, and 
varying variable names and datatypes.

name: setAttributeArrays
description: assign the attribute arrays.

name: bindAttributeLocations
description: Bind attribute locations.

name: getAttributes
description:
Create associative array with shader attributes.
NOTE: Only attributes actually used in the shader show.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} a collection of attributes, with .count = number.

return.description: a collection of attributes, with .count = number.

name: getUniforms
description:
Create associative array with shader uniforms.
NOTE: Only attributes actually used in the shader show.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} a collection of attributes, with .count = number.

return.description: a collection of attributes, with .count = number.

name: getVarying
description: Create associative array with shader varying variables.

name: checkShaders
description:
check to see if we're ready to run, after supplying 
shaders.

name: checkBufferObjects
description: Check if our VBO, IBO are ok.
